result.execSummary:
The defendant Edari R Pounds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*   Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges  (including DNA) by March 13, 2017.  Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

*   No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
*   No violent contact.
*   No contact with victim.
*   For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED defense counsel's motion for expungment.

*   Follow rules of supervision and agent.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of Correction. Huber release privileges for work and childcare ONLY: Report date: March 21, 2016 by 5:00 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edari R Pounds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $645.00 entered as ordered by the court on 05/23/16 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 08/01/2017. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 3 (three) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work and childcare ONLY:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 10 days in the House of
          Correction. Huber release privileges for work and 
          childcare ONLY: Report date: March 21, 2016 by 5:00 p.m.
     *   No weapons.
     *   No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
     *   No violent contact.
     *   Follow rules of supervision and agent.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with victim.
     *   Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges  (including DNA)
           by March 13, 2017. 
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry
          of a civil judgment.
.
For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED defense counsel's motion for expungment.
.
20 day appeal given,
    
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Sentencing Referral Form; received and filed.

Defendant Edari R Pounds in court with attorney Shauna D. Manion.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNT 2:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Edari R Pounds in court with attorney Shauna D. Manion.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference held off the record. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edari R Pounds in court with attorney Shauna D. Manion.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 31. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edari R Pounds in court pro-se.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel. 

Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Shauna Manion to represent the defendant; Attorney Shauna Manion to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing January 1, 2016.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgmentt.  Order signed and filed. Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edari R Pounds in court pro-se.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel. Defendant is not public defender eligible, additional time given by Court to retain private counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 31.   All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edari R Pounds in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for pretrial conference. Defendant needs additional time to obtain an attorney.
Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.
Status conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Edari R Pounds in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8/18/15 @ 1:30 pm
